@sainsburys So why did you do this and why donâ€™t you change it?

@sainsburys Your till system doesnâ€™t do anything, you classify non-alcoholic drinks as alcohol and then refuse to sell them in accordance with the licensing laws for alcoholic drinks. Why do you classify drinks that contain zero alcohol as alcohol?

Tried to buy a bottle of sparkling pear juice at @sainsburys at 9am this morning. They refused to sell it to me as they classify it as an alcoholic drink even though it has â€˜Alcohol Freeâ€™ printed in big letters on the front of the bottle.

@Roy1Batty I was seconded to work on the new MIS part of the new system that was being installed when they revamped the Control at Johnstone. Was supposed to be there for a few weeks and ended up spending 2 years there.
@Roy1Batty I was at the BTC from 93-94, then Cowcaddens until 2001 and then Control until 2003.
@Roy1Batty Yip. I was there for just over 10 years. 93 - 03
@Roy1Batty I started in Jan 93
@Roy1Batty When was that?

@Roy1Batty All dive stories are good stories if you are out and telling them! Once had an air leak from my tank while on a wreck dive. Also got separated from buddy and lost when we were in pitch black & 100 feet deep on bottom of a loch. Navigation skills with compass put to the test!
